Reviews.Title: “good location, good prices!”
Reviews.Author: donaldinhole
Reviews.Content: Staying on a budget, this was the option to take! Placed in a perfect location walking distance to everything, all the attractions and more! Rooms were small, though on a budget it was a perfect choice!

Reviews.Title: “NYC on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: The_Peppin-Hugheses
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I paid a flying visit to NYC and stayed 2 nights at Hotel 31. The room was cheap and had a shared bathroom, so our expectations were quite low... we wanted somewhere to sleep and nothing more. So we were pleased to be pleasantly surprised... the location was absolutely fantastic, within walking distance on the Empire State Building, Penn Station, Times Square... we also walked down to the 9/11 Memorial and the Staten Island ferry terminal, and also up to Central Park, but appreciate that this isn't everyone's idea of 'walking distance'! The room was on the small side and the window looked out onto a brick wall (essentially rendering the room windowless), but it was clean with a TV, phone and wash basin, and did exactly what we wanted it to do - gave us somewhere to sleep! There were two shared bathrooms near to our room, both were clean and we never had to queue. One was right next to our room and my fiance said that he woke a couple of times during the night due to people using the bathroom, but I slept right through. All in all, a great budget hotel which provides a fantastic base for exploring the city, but probably not for you if you like your hotels with a bit of luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 31 is a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Jasper F
Reviews.Content: Hotel 31 is a clean, charming, older hotel that is conveniently located in the Murray Hill section of the city. You get a lot of bang for the buck here. Just spent the weekend in NYC with my BFF. We rented a two bedroom with ensuite bathroom. Just off of 31st and Park Avenue, You'e in walking distance to The Empire State Building, Times Square and just about anywhere you wish to go. Very satisfied!!! Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonable in NYC, great location”
Reviews.Author: Clearwx
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly surprised by our room at Hotel 31. The room was typical of NYC hotels, on the small side, but clean and well appointed. Hard to beat at the cost. Many good restaurants within walking distance and the subway is around the corner. Great value in mid-town.

Reviews.Title: “It is just alright.”
Reviews.Author: Nicole N
Reviews.Content: Somehow it is close to the Penn station, and it is not. It is 5+ blocks away from Penn station so you may want to take the subway still (1 station only though, and there is not elevator in the subway, as I was told). The air-conditioner was very noisy. Still it is quite convenient and of lower cost so it may not be a bad choice if you are on a tight budget, and schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the money”
Reviews.Author: Ashley M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 31 for three nights. I had a room with a shared bathroom. The front desk was very helpful and nice upon check in. The room was nice, small, but nice. The air conditioner was pretty noisy and I could hear my neighbors but nothing to distressing. It was about a 20 minute walk from everything that I had planned. Overall it was great for the price and I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “An adequate place to crash”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaFI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for a night, for its proximity to Penn Station (about a ten minute walk). It's a good, central location close to a lot of attractions (Empire State could be seen from the window) and transportation - many within walking distance - earlier that day we had dropped our bags off and walked south to SoHo and later on we walked north to Columbus circle. So if you don't mind walking (and that's probably the best way to see anywhere) then the location should suit you just fine. As for the cost, at around 67 dollars (before taxes - after taxes 80) it was just about the cheapest thing in New York we could find for two people. For the location and quality this isn't a bad deal at all. The room was clean and decently kept, with a sink and a mirror, though the bathroom was shared. The bed was decently comfy though a little on the softer side. The decor of the hotel was a little dated but almost in a charming circa 1940s kind of way. The staff were nice, and had a convenient bag check service if you arrive before check in, or check out but need somewhere to drop your bags. However, it bears noting that the Hotel itself could use some renovations beyond decor. The soundproofing wasn't great and the walls were quite thin. If you're used to packing earplugs when you travel then this won't be a big deal at all. In short, one of the only major downsides was noise. Street noise is unavoidable in New York, but hearing the adjacent room's TV isn't. Either way this is hardly a big enough downside for which to avoid the place. Another downside was that the hot water took quite a while to circulate and the shower took a few minutes to heat up. Again, a rather petty complaint. In short - it's a very no frills kind of hotel that's a little outdated in a few ways. But if you're going to see the city and want a centrally located place just to crash that is better than a hostel, then this should suit you just fine. Especially if you're a student on a budget...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Susan H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Although the room was pretty small, the hotel is a good adress for backpackers. People who like walking through the city find here a hotel in the middle of Manhattan 7 min to the Empire State Building and 10 min to Grand Central. The Service was really fine. We had the possibility to leave our luggage in the hotel after checkout for another walk in the city. All in all price performance ratio is great so the two stars are completely right.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 31”
Reviews.Author: Darren M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really good for a budget hotel, clean helpful staff and not to far away from all the attractions and sights. if your on a budget and need a safe clean cheap place to stay I would recomend this hotel after all in New York you only need a place for your bags and to sleep. Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay”
Reviews.Author: Leah_M_12_12
Reviews.Content: Me and boyfriend have just come back from New York and stayed in Hotel 31. The hotel is amazing. We shared a bathroom but never had to wait for the bathroom to become available and they were always clean. The room was cleaned everyday and always had fresh towels. The room was quite warm but we were able to open the window which was fine. You couldn't hear any of the outside noise so we slept soundly. There is a TV in the room and one channel played recent films which was really good when you wanted to chill in the room. The hotel is very close to alot of the biggest sites. Empire State Building is 2 blocks away and Times Square is about a 15 minute walk away. Everything is very accessible. Will definitely stay here again as it is cheap and close to everything that you need.

Reviews.Title: “definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: resa123
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York solo so wanted to be in the middle of Manhattan with easy access to all the big attractions. Travelling on a budget, I could not have found a better place to stay and I would gladly return. The staff are very friendly and there is always someone on reception - very safe place to stay. The hotel is very clean, rooms are cleaned daily and the shared bathrooms are spotless. I was very hesitant about using shared bathrooms but everyone kept them tidy and they were also cleaned daily. The room I had was bigger than expected. I had a double room which came with a hairdryer, safe, TV and plenty of space to store luggage. Park Avenue is one avenue down and has plenty of places to grab some food, there is also a pizza restaurant 2 doors down from the hotel and a BBQ place across the road. It is a very conveniant location. About a 10 minute walk brings you to Times Square... I only used the room to sleep in as I was out constantly but it was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “great and efficient”
Reviews.Author: fabgirly2
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed one week. The rooms were small yes but I didnt come to NYC to spend my time in a hotel room unless it was to sleep. Sheets were clean. Great Flat screens TVs. We stayed in a shared bathroom room. I was so surprised as to how clean the bathroom area was, tub and floor. The only setback was that one night it rained really hard and the noise was extremely loud against the window and the A/C unit. The staff were always helpful in regards to directions and where the best deals were. Location is excellent, a short 15 minute walk to Times Square and right in front of the Empire State Building, Subway Line 6 is conveniently located on the next corner. Really surprised at how great the stay was, would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “poor but clean and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Erian
Reviews.Content: The room was extremely small and the window was in front of a wall, so that the room was always dark and you could not really feel fresh air. On the other hand the location is central, the price is very low and the cleaning is working well. The staff is really helpful and can give complete information about activities and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Try to get a good price”
Reviews.Author: Cable_Hogue
Reviews.Content: The management is trying hard here, and it shows. The lobby is recently remodeled. My room, on the 6th floor had its own bathroom (with a step up to it) but not all doâ€”so take care if this is a problem for you. The room wasn't big by suburban chain hotel standards, but was not small either. There were reports of bedbugs here, so I looked. To my pleasant surprise there were plastic enclosures around the mattress and box springâ€”and no sign of critters. The hotel is decently located in terms of public transit as well as being in a neighborhood that wasn't scary at night. The TV didn't have a million channels, but you're in New York. Why are you watching TV? Caveat: the elevator is small. Really small. I never had to wait real long for it, but I also had to squish in a bit if anyone else was riding.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amilou91
Reviews.Content: My Second visit and without a shadow of a doubt I will be back! The maid service was fantastic, spotless room everyday, towels changed, friendly staff and great location. For a budget trip to New York you will not get better than Hotel 31.

Reviews.Title: “Good news: cheap”
Reviews.Author: NHNomad60
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness I had just one night here. I had a confirmation in hand for a room with private bath. Upon arrival, well there just weren't any available. Nothing I said got any response other than a smile. In other words, tough luck honey...take it or leave it. I was late for a party, had to shower down the hall. I admit it was clean and the bed was comfortable, which is more than I can say for the room itself. It must have been 90 degrees, impossible to sleep in. All in all a lousy experience. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Keith S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on a Saturday night in December. The room itself was spotless. It's nothing huge but you're in NY, you shouldn't be spending that much time inside anyway! We booked a room with a private bath and the room, bathroom and hotel were all super clean. The value and location were great. I would easily reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, Convenient, Clean”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: Great location, small room (room 712), spotless. My only complaint was that it was little warm and I had to run the AC for awhile even though it was in the 30's outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, fantastic location, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: RachelLakin
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from New York after a girls weekend break. We decided on this hotel because of the location and price. We were a little dubious from reading reviews and the fact it was only 2 stars. We were very pleasantly surprised. The location was perfect for us, close to Times Square and within easy access of all the other attractions we wanted to visit. I don't know what is expected in America in terms of space, but coming from England we thought the rooms were spacious. Our room was a twin room so we were expecting single beds, we had 2 double beds, a dressing area and en suite bathroom. There was plenty of room for us. The beds were very comfortable, had good nights sleep every night. The room was cleaned and towels changed daily. Overall room and hotel was very clean. This room is old fashioned and very retro, we loved that about the hotel but some may not. If I ever get the chance to return to New York I would absolutely book this hotel again. Excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we booked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: leanne_gray
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. Right in the middle of Manhattan within easy walking distance to Times Squarel. Lovely rustic style that suited us well and the room we chose had shared bathroom facilities as it was the cheapest! Worked out around $90 a night I think, which is the same price as most dingy hostels in New York for 2 people! Has a life (albeit a very old but charming one) and stair access as well. Really helpful staff. GREAT pizza place next door which is always packed so either go early, book ahead or get take-away - seriously one of the most pizzas I've ever had. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable - but don't expect any space.”
Reviews.Author: Sandy C
Reviews.Content: My son and I had problems finding a twin room in N.Y. at an affordable price. We had 3 nights at this hotel (then did a tour) then returned for 1 night. The room was clean but basic (we shared bathroom - that was clean too) and tiny. I've never stayed in such a small hotel room before. Twin beds, 1 against each wall, small dresser in the middle, hanging space, sink and the room was filled. The room was very hot but we couldn't have the air-con on as it was far too loud when sleeping. The location was the best thing - it's a great spot to see Manhatten and yes, we had a view of the Empire State building on the final night (if you looked up past the brick wall outside the window). I wouldn't stay there again (I prefer a bit more space), but if you're used to backpacking, this would be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: sassypt
Reviews.Content: Okay i picked this hotel becasue of the reviews and yes it is a good hotel, but be warned that if you check in with a Visa Debit Card - they will put a hold on your card/checking account for about a week for the full amount, I know this is a standard thing for hotels to do , but it would have been nice to know about this before checking in. As for the staff being friendly, i didn't really see it except for the gentleman who showed us to our room (504). The room was clean and okay, they gave us clean towels each day, but never replaced the personal items - like soap; shamphoo. The location was okay, but I like being closer to Times Square. One other thing - there are no hand rails by the steps to the lobby after you get off the elevator / lift and I almost went thru the front wall because of this.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with good location.”
Reviews.Author: odman77
Reviews.Content: Older hotel hotel with worn rooms but If you want to stay at a okay hotel with a good location there is nothing more affordable in Manhattan. The rooms are worn, but has everything you need: a comfortable bed, TV, desk and sink. The windows do not seem quite dense and the question is how the heat is held in the winter, maybe okay. Shared bathrooms were always clean and fresh. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, amazing location, and had a great view of the Empire from the window!”
Reviews.Author: Stokieontherun
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere to crash at night, and close to the center of New York - nothing special. This hotel is perfect for tourists as it is right next to the empire state building, close-ish to the chrysler building, and a metro station right around the corner - most of all good value. The hotel its self was nice and clean, staff seemed friendly enough when we spoke to them or asked a question. The room was a good size, and had plenty of room to leave the suitcases sprawled out + space to walk around. We had a communial bathroom which wasn't as much as a burden as we thought it would be - no waiting and it did the trick for a 5min shower. There are a few little places dotted nearby too such as a bakery type place for a feed before a tourist mission, pizza place for when you get back, sports bar for a drink etc. If your happy to walk, then its quite a nice walk to Times Square (we managed it in the snow a few times!). To sum up. If your looking for a hotel that you want to stay in for a good portion of the day, watching TV, using a bar, resturant etc then I would suggest elsewhere. If your a tourists and on a budget, and looking for somewhere to sleep, close to the action - This is hotel is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: snmgagirl
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews but this hotel deserves it. My hubby and I just returned from our hooneymoon a day ago. We took the train to Niagara Falls Canda, but decided to stay a night in NYC before heading to Canada. I booked this hotel at last minute because our other one was full, and by the pictures and reviews I was expecting alittle worse than what we recieved. The front desk people were really nice and when I called I just booked a shared bath but when wer arrived we got a private bath. Our room was 408 and wasn't real roomy but it was just us two and we just really slept because when we got there we put our stuff up and headed out to see the city. and stayed out all night. I liked this hotel and the price isnt to bad for where its located. We will visit again and book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget stay in New York”
Reviews.Author: Joey090
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel 31 for 4 nights with my boyfriend at the end of our American road trip in May. Looking at the prices of hotels in New York I thought we were lucky to find this place for reasonable price at a very central location. Only couple of blocks away from Empire state building, about 15-20 min walk to Time square, good choice of restaurants in the area. OK the room was quite small, but nice and clean, didn't spend much time in it anyway why would you when visiting New York. Shared bathrooms were always clean, they must have been checked even during the night. If you have a car parking can be a bit of a hassle. We got explained by different members of staff few times how you can park on the street for free after certain time but really early in the morning you would have to move your car on the other side of the street to continue parking for free (or something along those lines). Luckily we only had our rental car for one more night so we just parked in a car park near by and paid. Over all a very pleasant stay, would definitely consider this hotel for our next trip to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and clean... nothing to complain... does what if offers.”
Reviews.Author: KittyKipling
Reviews.Content: Cute and clean little Hotel in a great location. I was not sure what to expect from a 2 star Hotel in New York. I heard all sorts of horrible stories of other hotels. I was very pleased when i entered the hotel. It has a lovely New York atmosphere. Itâ€™s not a new, fancy hotel and some of the wall paper is dated... but who cares. The staff was very helpful when we needed information or an iron. I love the elevator. It does not have a spa or breakfast room... but it's in Manhattan and if you want to go out and explore the city itâ€™s a good hotel. The mattress was a bit noisy so. I have no problem to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Similar to Hotel 17 but a little better”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: It's the same basic concept as Hotel 17, except this one is in midtown. We were lucky-- the staff person at the front desk was very kind; gave us very simple (of course) but still comfortable room looking out at the Empire State Building. It felt like it was one of the better rooms, and he knew this. Quiet, definitely no frills, but for what it was it worked. It's a bare bones hotel, but it still makes the effort within those bare bones.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Barbara R
Reviews.Content: When all you need is clean room and a comfortable bed in between exploring the city, then you really can't go wrong with this small traditional hotel. Rooms are tiny and no-frills, bathrooms are shared and the old-fashioned lift is a bit hard to negotiate, but here you're a couple of blocks from the Empire State, Grand Central, Broadway & Times Square, with easy access to subway stations. Staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were really well-heated during one of the coldest winters New York has had, and there were lots of eating options close by. I would certainly stay here again and have recommended it to several friends as a good budget option in an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “It was fabbity fab fab!”
Reviews.Author: JayAre43
Reviews.Content: Honestly I could not have asked for a better place to stay during my visit. I was there for 2 nights at the end of Sept 2011 and there were no bugs, which was one of my biggest concerns. I didn't give it 5 stars because the sheets weren't quite "bright white" and the room was just a little smellly (no bad, just...off?). But the location was great, just a few blocks away from all the big sites (time square, empire state, etc) and the train/bus stations. Umm, sharing a bathroom was no problem especially because there were multiple bathrooms on each floor. There was a TV and AC in the room which both had remotes and yeah, it was great. Will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Lazo2310
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you want to stay is a great location at a budget price. The rooms are small and the the decor is aged but it is safe, clean has everything you need when you're a tourist. There is a subway on the next block but it is so nice just to walk in NYC. Empire State building is just around the corner and many other shops & attractions also in short walking distance. We had a bathroom in the room which all worked well and was clean with fresh towels. Would recommend to anyone wanting a cheap stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: sunshine505
Reviews.Content: Stayed in August 2011 and could be described in 3 words... dark dingy dreadful. It has to be the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. The room was so small I had to climb over my partner to get in/ out the bed!! It was all dark decor which looked at least 40 yrs old with cheap nasty bedding. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “So itchy”
Reviews.Author: Aido1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in february, my first impressions were, oh no. The hotel looked like faulty towers the UK sitcom from the 70s, the lift could barly fit two people in it. Then the rooms, small is not the word, these were tiny. The decorative on the walls and beds were from the 1950s they looked so old fashioned and so out of place. But i said to myself, its new york, i wont be in the room to often. And that was the case, we were only in the room for 8 hours a night then we were out for teh rest of the time. The location was OK, it was still a good walk to the empire state building, but it was fine. All was good until our third night and last night, when both me and my fiancee broke out in hives and a rash from bed bugs. It put a damper on the break, we wont be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: suzy85
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive of staying in New York alone but this Hotel is central to shops, trains and all sights. Its clean and safe with very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “neat and cozy”
Reviews.Author: steffi239
Reviews.Content: When we went there in september 2010 we had a great time. the hotel is kind of old and if you look for something big with a lot of comfort you are on the wrong address. The rooms are old too and there was no bathroom in the room. But since there are a couple located in the hall you are fine. they clean it after every use. hotel staff is really friendly. it is located just a couple of blocks from empire state building and there is a subway station just up the street.

Reviews.Title: “Better without Bugs”
Reviews.Author: CubanWaters
Reviews.Content: Like it's sister, Hotel 17, these types of hotels are not for everyone. If you are just interested in a place to store your luggage, wash up and have a bed to rest in, then it is perfect. There is no lobby to speak of and some rooms are quite small with shared bathrooms. The hotel has an old charm to it though and does not resemble the plain chain establishments that go hand in hand with cheapness. Decently furnished with some style. The area, although not seemingly anything special, is central enough for getting to some of the more absorbing parts of Manhattan. A good parking garage is located the next block over to the east and the Empire State building is just a few blocks up. Would really like to give this place a better rating but severely itchy legs can put a crack in anyone's good time and bed bugs do not get a high rating in my book!

Reviews.Title: “Overworked clerk was rude to me”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugWest
Reviews.Content: You could say I gave this "chain" another shot because i picked its "sister chain" Hotel 17. Also the price and reviews of both were equal. But I gave a call to them around early July to inquire about the rates & availability for August. The clerk at the desk seemed overworked and was rude to me. I asked to speak to the manager about his rude tone & lack of help but he just hung up on me. From all the good reviews I believe this place is on a good term basis with its customers. But for my situation, I must have caught him on a bad day. If there is a management body that reads these reviews, please tell the young man working at the desk on July 11, 2011 that I could not reach you because of the overworked clerk hung up on me.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Bee02
Reviews.Content: I hate to pay $200+ a night for a hotel so cheap hotels are always a lure. That said, I also hate finding myself in a dirty room with no air conditioning and often I find it's not worth the savings. Luckily I have no such complaints about Hotel 31. A shared washroom is always an area of concern but we have no issues there. We found the washrooms were always quiet (we're early risers, 7am-ish) and they seemed to be cleaned frequently. The only thing lacking was maybe in the front desk staff. One guy was very friendly but there were a couple of others who would barely acknowledge us and weren't at all interested in helping us with any questions. I guess I wasn't paying for a helpful concierge so I couldn't expect too much :-) Basically I liked the location of the hotel and although I can't rave about the room I can say it was clean and neat (if a little dark) and for the price I paid I'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: letpeablak
Reviews.Content: Whenever I visit nyc, I use trip advisor to find very affordable places to stay. I read the reviews and then decide if it's a place that i want to try out. I also like to try different places so that I can have a variety to choose from with each visit. This was my first time to stay at Hotel 31 and it will definitely be on my list to choose from in the future. The staff was very friendly and helpful, our room was very clean and comfortable, the location is safe and convenient with subway just block and 1/2 away.. This was my first time to use shared bathroom....It was right by our room, and we never had to wait to go in. New York is not the kind of city where you spend a lot of time in your room, so I was not really concerned about a shared bathroom anyway. I definitely recommend Hotel 31 and will definitely be returning. Soon, i hope!!

Reviews.Title: “Second visit and just as good”
Reviews.Author: alicia_rich
Reviews.Content: This place is brilliant value for money considering the location. The rooms are pretty basic but clean and although we wouldn't normally be happy to share a bathroom, they're also clean and it's never a problem finding a free one.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: dkhTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a couple of days while we were touring New York. The location provides convenient access to mid-town, and there is a subway a couple of blocks away. We were concerned about booking a place with shared bathrooms, but they were kept very clean. Our room was small, but in good shape and the bed was excellent. The staff was very helpful. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with personality and great location”
Reviews.Author: cecima
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at 31st Street and Lexington, and we were really pleased with the location. It was safe and a short cab ride to most places. The shared bathrooms were no problem as they were kept clean at all times. The beds aren't super comfortable and the wallpapering in our room was interesting to say the least (loud flowers mixed with lous stripes,- my eyes hurt :) ), but we still enjoyed our stay. The italian restaurant at the corner of Lexington has amazing pizza, and at the other courner there's a little food-store that makes egg- and bacon sandwithces etc if you need a quick breakfast to go. The hotel does have room-service, but we never tried it.

Reviews.Title: “Should be renting rooms hourly...”
Reviews.Author: mghtycthul
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no service... Rooms are closets... Staff didn't lift a finger to help... Acted like we were putting them out by renting a room... Shower did not work... Toliet leaked profusely... Absolutely horrible...

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: morramate
Reviews.Content: It's always a bit of a gamble booking a budget hotel at a distance but Hotel 31 lived right up to all the good reviews it has received on Trip Advisor. We had an en suite room for seven nights and it was all you could want. . Cosy and comfotable it just seemed to epiomise the New York experience. Room not enormous, elevator a relic of another era were all part of the charm and O so convenient to attractios and Subway If you stay you must try the Japanese Restayrant next door, it's wonderful Graham Tasmania And a

Reviews.Title: “Great stay again :)”
Reviews.Author: paulandsuerus
Reviews.Content: Just about to check out of hotel 31 :(. We have once again had a wonderful experience here.last time we stayed we had our own bathroom but this time we were sharing and it was no problem at all! Spotless always and not any signs of bed bugs etc would stay here again.excelent location

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/Great price!”
Reviews.Author: meddr2018
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel 31 for 5 days. We were somewhat apprehensive and this was our first trip to NYC. The staff was wonderful on the phone and in person. We had the shared bathrooms and never had to wait to take a shower. The floor(s) are divided into two sides with 2 bathrooms on each. They were always immaculate! Great location for walking and access to the MTA bus system and subway. Plenty of restaurants nearby for morning coffee, lunch and/or dinner. I would highly recommend you don't miss out on this gem..they deliver at an unbeatable price!

Reviews.Title: “No Service, Lots of Roaches, but Cheap for Manhanttan”
Reviews.Author: jahsgirl2
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel has a great cleaning crew, they have a serious roach problem, however, I was very thankful I did not experience any bedbugs. If you need any service whatsoever, forget it; you can't even rely on this hotel for a wake up call. We had one of the best rooms on the top floor with a private bathroom, the other rooms that I looked at were small and unpleasant looking with shared bathrooms. The rate was very reasonable and the location is excellent, just check your bags thoroughly before you leave to ensure that you don't take any unwanted hitchhikers home with you. I would only recommend this hotel to someone who is on a very tight budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: EssexSteve30
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from the 2nd to 7th February and we are so pleased we did. Check in was a breeze, straight up to the counter, room key was handed over and off we went. No hassle and no fuss and with a pleasant service. Every day when passing reception we would get a good morning or evening. We were in room 802 on surprise surprise the 8th floor (top floor) and we used the lift all the time to go up. Yes, it's old, but works perfectly well, and I quite liked the rustic feel of it. From watching old american movies, it was good to see something of this charm. Yes the room are a little on the small side, but there was more than enough space for our luggage and the double bed is very comfortable with clean sheets. Considering this is winter, we only had jeans and jumpers, we had no real need to hanging space, which is just as well as the room only had 3 hangers, but I'm sure we would have been provided with more if needed. The room had a sink with mirror and the bathroom was right next door and was always spotless. Once the bathroom was occupied, there is another on the opposite side, or it's just as easy to pop up or down a floor if you're desperate. It's in a super location, close to some major attractions and the subway entrance is on either 28th or 33rd street and literally 2 minutes walk away. It's on the green 6 line and runs the length of Manhatten which was perfect for us first timers. Check out was easy as pie, and we had a little problem with our pre booked transfer to the airport, but the guy behind the reception (sorry I can't remember your name) helped us out loads. For Â£46 per night for two people, you really can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “OK ish”
Reviews.Author: GenuineJudge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is within walking diatance to time square and good value for new york BUT its like going into a time machine and arriving in 50's new york..decor...size...and the wallpaper!!!...very old lift....old style but some wud like it.Front desk was poor and little help....poor custmer skills. This place could be fantastic buts it basic and needs to be brought up to standards. small small small rooms!!! not reccomended for a long stay

Reviews.Title: “Old room but clean. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: vcarolina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights with my mom. I originally booked at Manhattan Broadway hotel but we had a problem with our inbound flight to NY so I booked Hotel 31 the night before our arrival. Check in was fast and no fuss. The room looked very old, sort of vintage. There was no bathroom but there was a sink so at least we were able to brush our teeth/wash our faces in our room. The bed and linen looked old too but clean. My mom and I slept very soundly both nights, although on our first night we got woken up at 5am by mice. We left our suitcases open and I guess the mice got into one of our plastic bags. So we took the contents of our suitcases out, inspected everything and zipped the bags up. We didn't hear that noise again the next night but we kept our bags zipped up all the time. The shared bathroom was quite clean. Considering 5-6 rooms were sharing the same bathroom, my mom and I were both surprised that it was kept clean. Overall, I'm very happy with this place. It's just a few block's walk from everything so although the building is old, it's a very good deal. My work takes me to Manhattan quite a lot and I stay in Radisson Lexington... and the only difference is I have a bathroom in my room. Radisson just has a nicer lobby and a Starbucks at the ground floor but the rooms are similar to Hotel 31. So if you're gonna pay from your own pocket, this hotel is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL _ HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: ABCDEFG_1234
Reviews.Content: This is a FANTASTIC place to stay whilst in New York! It is conveniently located 20 minutes from TImes Square walking (plus lots of other tourist attractions) and has good subway connections close by. The hotel itself is lovely. There is a quaint old elevator (we were on the 7th floor) which works well. The staff were very friendly, especially Suhail. Our room overlooked the Empire State building. We had a shared bathroom but it was not a problem. I waited once, it was always spotless. the cleaning in the the hotel is excellent. the room was always clean as were the bathrooms. The room is on the small side but this is New York and its location really makes up for it. The rooms have sinks in and a TV. Free internet The room sometimes gets a bit hot but opening the window s not a problem. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a budget hotel in New York. Great place to stay. 5*****

Reviews.Title: “no temperature control”
Reviews.Author: OhioMargo
Reviews.Content: This place is a great value and very good location, if you want affordable. We stayed here in January, when temperature was 20-30 degrees outside, while the room was maybe 80-90 degrees. There was no way to control the temperature in the room. Even after it was reported to the manager, it was not improved. But the windows open! So we stayed with open windows, and it was rather nice to feel the cool air and watch the snow come down. we will stay here again! But then we like adventure and affordability ! P.S. rooms are very small!

Reviews.Title: “Retro style hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Nastya_Aktau
Reviews.Content: I think that the retro mood of the hotel suits New York perfectly! We stayed in the room with a shared bathroom but it was not inconvenient at all. The bathroom was clean at all times. The room was fairly small but exactly as it was on the picture on the hotel's website and even though it is small, we had no difficulties to arrange our luggage and feel comfortable. The personnel is very helpful and polite. They also have a specially designated room to store your luggage after your check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: chunkymonkey_uk
Reviews.Content: Hotel 31 was exactly what we expected for the money we paid - rough around the edges but comfortable and convenient. The location is fantastic, we walked almost everywhere but if you aren't quite as able bodied there is a metro stop 3minutes walk away. The staff were friendly and helpful and there was no problem with us having a late check in (although we did call in advance) or storing our bags there before our flight home. The building itself was compact but perfectly functional, the old lift was a lovely feature and never took too long to come. The corridors were narrow and our room was fairly small and could have done with a bit more surface space, but the bed was comfy, there was a sink and we could see the empire state building from our window. The room was also nice and warm. The decor was a bit dated and there were some odd wallpaper choices but it was neat and tidy and everything was clean (rooms were cleaned and towels replaced every day). The shared bathrooms were small but clean and we normally didn't have to wait to use them. Our room was next door to a bathroom but very quiet and you couldn't hear the bathroom being used. If you are just looking for a comfortable place to sleep and want to have some money left to spend on all the other great things to do in NYC, then this is the place for you, we'd definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, and very clean”
Reviews.Author: JamesMc40
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel 31 in NYC 3 times now. The Hotel is basic, and rooms are small but for a City break It is a great location, just down the road from the Empire state building. The hotel is good value for money for traveller on a budget and is very clean. I recommend Hotel 31 to you all! Remember to tip the old porter well, he is very helpful and must be 75 years old if he is a day!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nice777001
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. The front desk was helpful. Easy walking to the Shopping Garmet District and lots of Restaurants. Rooms were always clean and spotless. We checked and found No Bedbugs!! No Roaches!! Bathrooms were kept immaculate. We look forward to staying here again on our next visit in the Spring 2011. Great Place.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character...but also lots of cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: calligram
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was extremely pleasant when we arrived, and the older gentlemen who showed us up to our room was fantastic! The room was pretty barebones...but about what you'd expect for a hotel at this price point. Everything looked cleaned, so we settled in. Unfortunately, just as we were getting into bed for the night we discovered several cockroaches in the bathroom. After killing three of them, we decided it was time for another room. The front desk staff was very apologetic and moved us to a new room, but we decided to check out in the morning to seek newer (and more expensive) accommodations. I understand with older buildings in New York, a bug here or there is inevitable, but a swarm of cockroaches kind of put me over the edge. If you don't mind being on bug-watch, this hotel should fit your bill - great location, and no signs of any bedbugs in the room we were in. If you like newer rooms with more amenities, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quaint, comfortable and not a bedbug in sight!”
Reviews.Author: jkm13
Reviews.Content: We were a little trepidatious about our November 5 stay after reading some of these reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. The front desk staff checked us in quickly. The hallway leading to our room smelled heavily of cigarette smoke, but our room did not. The room was the size of a typical double bed budget hotel, but the woodwork around the door was beautiful, with what looked like the original rosettes. We had a private bath, the tile looked new and everything was perfectly clean. We tore the beds apart, looking for evidence of bedbugs mentioned by other reviewers. It looked like the rooms might have been treated and the mattress and box spring were sealed in protective plastic. When we returned to our room, it was warm, from the steam heat, but we turned on our window air conditioner unit for a little while and then left the fan on all night to drown out any street noise (what is with New Yorkers and constant honking?!). When we checked out the next morning, they checked our bags so that we didn't have to carry them with us on our sight seeing. The hotel is located in Murray Hill, so it is a bit of a hike to Times Square and Broadway, but we didn't have to pay the same price as the hotels located in those areas, either. And the view of the Empire State Building as we walked back to our hotel was breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice old place, clean, good location, perfect for a single traveler.”
Reviews.Author: LolaTravels
Reviews.Content: I'm a single woman who visited NYC in October, and stayed at Hotel 31 for 3 nights. My room was small, but clean, quaint, and comfortable. The shared bathrooms are very clean and neat. There was only one time that it was occupied and I had to go to another one down the hall. No hassle at all. GREAT location. "Iggy," the octogenarian bellman was an added attraction. :)

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says it'll do”
Reviews.Author: TimWh
Reviews.Content: It's not the most luxurious place I've been to and in most cities it'd be much cheaper, but this is a good base to explore most of the main sites of New York. Staff were helpful whenever we asked them anything. The room was clean, although there were a few holes in the walls and several sorts of wallpaper from different eras in the one room. No bedbugs! Wonderful old creaky lift, if you like old creaky lifts (which we did). One warning: the rooms at the front of the hotel can be even noisier than normal in New York due to the Mid Town Tunnel nearby. But then no one comes here for the quiet.....my 6 year old daughter loved the place; there's a great pizza restaurant a couple of doors down on the same street and a good diner round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “clean, simlple and no bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Neptune24
Reviews.Content: On our flight over we read about the New York bed bug infestation and having read an earlier review of the hotel we were concerned. However, delighted to report that it was a little gem of a place to stay. Found the hotel very easily. Great location close to Empire Stae and Grand Central Station. Macy's just a 10 minmute walk away. Times square a little further. Subway just 2 mimutes away. The hotel was adequate for our needs for a short stay. On arrival we were given a room that we had not booked (no private facilities) as we put the key in the lock reception rang to say that it was their error and we were moved immediately. The staff were very helpful in looking after our luggage on the last day, answering all queries, phoning for our airport transfers. The room was clean, the bathroom was a little small but had a bath and a shower. Plenty of hot water and toiletries provided. Towels changed daily and sheets changed during our 4 night stay. The room by USA standards was small but had 2 queen size beds. We had a coffee maker in the room and air con. There is no breakfast provided but we ate at Cosi every morning less than a 100 yards away from hotel. Coffes, teas, orange juice, porridge, bagels etc. We saw the shared bathrooms on the corridor and they always were clean and never seemed to be used. Give the hotel a try - it's simple, clean and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: Ickle1979
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel this place is great. Not too far from anywhere be it by walking or subway. On occasion it was a little noisy at night, general city noises like police sirens, but that's outside the hotels control. I had a room with a private bathroom which was kept clean. The room had a safe, AC, coffee making facilities and TV, can't really ask for more at these prices. My room was a decent size and was at the back of the hotel. Staff were pleasant but not overly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 31 is the best budget hotel in Manhattan.”
Reviews.Author: CarolPage
Reviews.Content: Hotel 31 is the best budget hotel in Manhattan. Weâ€™ve stayed there many times, the last visit a whole week, so we know it pretty well. It reminds us very much of a European pension, complete with a small elevator with an expanding gate, which although slow is ever reliable. We always take a room with a bath down the hall, and it has never been a problem. None of the baths are far from any room, and there are two on each floor; if both are occupied and youâ€™re desperate, just go to the floor above or below. They are always clean enough for our standards. The beds are sufficiently comfortable, but our one and only complaint about this place is the wallpaper, which looks like it was bought at a closeout sale. Some of the rooms are small, but they all have sinks in them, which is very handy. The staff are always helpful, even if they donâ€™t always seem approachable. Weâ€™ve never asked for anything that we didnâ€™t get quickly, and weâ€™ve gotten lots of good advice from the desk people. The hotel is conveniently located to a tasty, economical and friendly breakfast spot at the corner of Park and 31st (Guy & Gallard). The location is also terrific for public transportation: buses run uptown 2 blocks over, the 4-5-6 subway line is within a block either way, and the many connections at Herald Square & Penn Station are a short walk past the Empire State building. Who stays at this budget mecca? Young folks, retired folks, middle-class folks from all over the world who disdain paying $250 a night for an ordinary bed and bath. Youâ€™ll be in good company at Hotel 31.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in good central location”
Reviews.Author: elmfield
Reviews.Content: Good location for sightseeing trip in New York. Walkable distance from Penn Station, Empire State Building & other attractions. Also close to subway and bus routes if you don't want to walk too far. Advertised check-in time 3pm but we checked in earlier about 1.30 with no problem. Room we'd been allocated with double and twin wasn't ready so they simply gave us a different room with 2 doubles, Room not overly large but adequate with ensuite bathroom. Clean and quiet. Room had safe box which was useful. Beds made-up and towels changed daily. No breakfast but cafe's and bars within few hundred yards. Locked room for left-luggage on day of departure. Concierge not overly friendly but no problems and assisted courteously with the few requests we had. Would use again on next trip without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, great value”
Reviews.Author: thelostgirl_uk
Reviews.Content: For those of you traveling to NYC on a budget, Hotel 31 is a great value. It's rates are like 120-130 per night, and you won't find anything cheaper in NYC with the same location and cleanliness. There is only one elevator and stairs, and the elevator is old school, with a gate that you have to pull shut before getting shuttled between floors. Needless to say, the old elevator is very slow and the wait might take a while, depending on if it's busy during that time of day. The bathrooms are shared, there's 2 per floor. Although this may turn some people off, all of the times I've used the bathroom it was recently cleaned. I think the maids/janitors come around VERY often, and if the bathroom looks like someone used it, they tidy it up right away. The rooms are tiny, it's either a full or queen bed with maybe 3-4 ft or walking room on either side. There's also an A/C, tv, and sink in each room. Basic. No frills. The location is great, when I was there July 2010, there was a new take out sushi/bento box/japanese "fast food" place right across the street which was awesome for those quick food runs!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location - excelletn overall!!”
Reviews.Author: Mackem56
Reviews.Content: Hotel was brilliant - a great location, very handy for subway. Room was spot on, yes its small but bijou!!! Bathroom was great. Bed was really comfy and I had some of the best nights sleep in ages - great pillows too!!! Lots of restaurants close by, and only 5 mins from Empire State Building. What more can you ask for? Hotel staff were great, very helpful. Yes the lift was old and quaint but heyho its very quirky. This was a grea place to base myself for my visit - I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Traumatizing!!”
Reviews.Author: Zazajaja
Reviews.Content: Not a happy experience as got moved to this hotel due to a associated hotel loosing our booking. Lift was crap n old! Carpet was sticky! Shared bathroom was filth n got bad bites all over my legs from the bed bugs!!! Smelt so strong of soap cleaning products it was more a spray then actually being clean surfaces! Do not stay here not worth the price either n happy only had 1 night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small but suitable room, moody staff”
Reviews.Author: Spoocaz
Reviews.Content: Hotel 31 is well located on 31st st close to Lexington and Park avenues, this means it is about a 5min walk to the Empire State Building and not much more to Macy's and other shops. Its also just round the corner from the 33rd st subway making access to the tip of Manhatten or uptown relatively easy. The room was reasonable if a bit small and we shared a bathroom, which was clean. The view from the window was a brick wall however, so it did get a bit dark and as it was mid-summer it could get hot without the a/c. While we were happy enough with the room, there were 2 downsides - the scary claustrophobic lift and the rude reception staff, who made you feel like even asking a simple question was a massive inconvenience to them.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manchester71
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our one night stay at this hotel. It is old fashioned, but we thought this gave it a certain charm. The room was fine, and the bathrooms very clean. The hotel was quiet and the staff friendly. This was one of the cheaper hotels when we booked, and it has an excellent location, near the Empire State building, and Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Samwow99
Reviews.Content: First off they trick you with pictures, so don't fall for it! The location isn't even near anything good. Before I begin with the horror know this," Cheap things aren't good and good things aren't cheap." We walk into the hotel which was a hike from everything, the staff were kinda shady, we get to our room and it's to s**t. It was closet size. Bed bugs, of course. I didn't want to walk around with no shoes on, bathrooms are shared, oh and if you mistakely go up to the last floor like I did, run, you may see a bat. I almost fell through the floor. I literally felt a pipe when I was walking in the hallway. Felt like a scam, the prices for that s**thole aren't low enough for the stay there. What could of topped such a horrible stay you ask.. the sound of the guest next door boning. Thanks thin walls! Don't do it to yourself. I was so annoyed I put it on youtube, why I hate NY -Samwow99

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, good price, shared bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Living_strong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming. It has a tiny elevator, and the gate needs to be manually operated. Rooms are small, and contain beds and a sink. The toilets and showers are shared. My daughter and I stayed in a room with twin beds, in the heat of August, and had no problems. The a/c unit in the room was easy to operate, the alarm clock worked, we had no issues with taking showers or using the bathroom whenever we wanted to. There was an iron fire escape that had a small landing, and we found that a nice place to go for a private phone call. The hotel was nicely situated, and the price was excellent for NYC. Good choice if you plan to just use the room for sleeping and other basics.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised (after reading some of the reviews on here!)”
Reviews.Author: lini_lew
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked a room with these guys because they were the cheapest he could find in NYC. Then we saw the reviews and the pictures... OMG we thought, what a mistake. The picture with the squashed bed bug actually looks like a cockroach with raspberry couli poured on it, but needless to say, we weren't exactly looking forward to our stay at Hotel 31. We scoured our room for any bed bugs (or their droppings in the mattress) upon arrival and thankfully found absolutely nothing. From then on it only gets better. The front desk guy was extremely helpful and the room service/cleaning staff were very good at their job and did nice little things like pop the air con on for us for when we got back from our NYC travels (it was +100degF all that week!!!). I was a bit apprehensive about sharing a bathroom with 5 other rooms (as I'm not used to hostel-like accom) but it was kept very clean and there were no problems at all. Sleeping was also fine, the hotel is quiet and we were well back from the street. The hotel's location is great. There are heaps of big NYC attractions within strolling distance, the 31st St subway station is just around the corner and there are some cool resteraunts on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills hotel a short from the subway & Empire State Building.”
Reviews.Author: DoverRuben
Reviews.Content: I paid $100 per night plus tax through Booking.com and got what I expected. A small double room, no view, wash basin, tv and handy safe. For me on my own, it was perfectly adequate. It was also very clean, including the bedding, as were the shared bathrooms just a few steps away, which were rarely occupied when I wanted them. The bed was extremely comfortable. Staff were pleasant, and allowed me to leave my case after checking out on the last morning. The street is quiet, and there are excellent restaurants nearby ( especially if you like Indian food -take a right on Lexington.) The Cosi diner on the corner does a good breakfast. The 33rd St. subway is 5 mins walk. My only complaint would be that the air conditioning unit in the window was very noisy. As I was there in a heat wave, I had to choose between noise and heat. I chose heat, but didn't sleep very well. If you are used to air con, it'll be no problem. I tried sleeping with the window open, but there was still a sort of whirring sound, even with the air con off. Nevertheless, I would recommend this hotel for the price I paid for Central Manhattan, and hope to return in cooler weather. Bed bugs? Never saw a one.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel and close to attaction and shopping”
Reviews.Author: JoyToronto
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I was rather iffy when my boyfriend booked a hotel with shared bathroom. Our room was tiny with a double bed and an AC in the window. I began to like it at Hotel 31. There was a sink in our room so we can do things like brush our teeth and wash up in our room. The shared washroom was very clean. There are two full washrooms on our floor (I think it is like this for every floor). We hardly ever had to wait and more importantly it was very CLEAN. The room was clean too! The bed was very comfortable. The elevator is an old fashioned one where you have to open the door and gate....it came pretty quickly and you won't even have to use if if you're in the lower floors. The hotel has complimentary wireless internet but it is slow. All in all, we had an amazing experience and would definitely stay at hotel 31 again!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, Decent Value, Make Sure Your Bedding Is Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Kansastraveller1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in June, 2010. I liked this hotel. It has a lot of character. It's very old, but pretty charming. My room, a single, was quite small, but suited my purposes well. If you aren't going to be in the hotel a lot, then this place will work fine. My room was clean, except for a couple of hairs on my bed sheets. The fact that i shared a bathroom with at least a couple of others originally turned me off, but it worked out okay. You can't beat the price of this hotel. And it was convenient too. All in all, i would stay here again, but i would make sure my sheets are clean when i check in!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY INFESTED WITH BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: 123NYCgal123
Reviews.Content: DO not stay here! My friend checked in today, as he is visiting NYC for 6 days. He is a pest control professional by trade, so of course he knew to check. He discovered what he called a "very severe" infestation in his room. He reported it to management, who moved him to another room. Guess what! YTHat room was full of bed bugs too. Aside from biting you, they can get into your luggage and on your clothes and in your possessions and you can transport them home. Ridding your home of them is a lengthy, very expensive, and miserable ordeal, so he could not stay here. Management refused to help, and he ended up paying for another hotel, received no refund - nothing, despite the fact that the rooms are infested with parasites and not fit for human habitation. The place should be shut down as a health hazard... With such an epidemic of bed bugs, the fact that they do not even address it and let an infestation carry on to such a degree and expose peope to it is unacceptable. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: si_mongoose
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in a double room with shared bath, Location was great, a couple of minutes walk from a metro stop, down a quietish street but safe. The shared bathroom was clean and almost always available. If you're looking for a budget hotel within easy travel of all major sights then you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “A can-do hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pinnate
Reviews.Content: My room was small with the window facing the neighbour's side wall, but I guess this is New York, where space is limited and expensive. But both room and shared bathroom are very clean though. Although shared, there was no waiting for the bathroom, except once. It seems always to be available. I hate the old-fashioned lift. Not easy to manage the iron grille trying to get in and out of the lift when you have luggage. Staff curt and not friendly. But again, I guess this is New York. Location is OK. The hop on/hop off tourist bus I took for the 2 days runs just 100 meters away. There is a subway station just 2 streets away on 33rd street. The Indian restaurant around the block. - that is a must! Good food, friendly staff, reasonable price... So too is restaurant along the same street (Lexington Ave.) on 33rd street. Good for breakfast there before you move on for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Not too sure about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Reiziger1976
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, one time for one night and one time for 2 nights. Both times in a room with shared bathroom. Both times I was happy to leave. It is the only hotel in Manhattan where I have stayed so I can not compare but this hotel did not feel very welcoming or very safe to me. The good thing about Hotel 31 is its location and I had quite a good deal I think with booking online (directly). But because it feels like everyone can walk in (you dont have to swipe a card or anything to go from reception to upstairs), it feels a little unsafe. This is not helped by all the warnings that you should not leave anything of value in your room, but I guesos its NY after all. Both my rooms had no view and the window was a meter from the concrete wall of the building next door. The second room I stayed in had the most horrific and claustrofobic decor, multi coloured horizontal stripes and flowers all around. The second time I stayed it smelled like someone had peed against the wall in the hall way and it really smelled. The cleaners did their best to clean it but it did not really help. So, maybe this is all quite normal in Manhattan but as a solo traveler I would not recommend this - the third time in NY I ended up staying outside of Manhattan in arty Brooklyn (in a B&B) and enjoyed it much better.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the place - but weird stuff happened”
Reviews.Author: Nitestar
Reviews.Content: Finding a reasonable hotel room in NYC is almost impossible - and this is why I ended up at Hotel 31. After reading all the reviews, I decided to take a chance. I actually enjoyed my stay there, but some weird and annoying "little" things happened that made my stay a little more difficult than it needed to be. However, I supposed this is to be expected when you stay at smaller type of hotels that are not "chain hotels". The good: The location is pretty good. It is situated right around the corner from one of the best Indian restaurants I have ever visited - called Yogi's Kitchen, so if you stay at the hotel, make sure you visit the restaurant. It is quite a hike from Penn Station - if you have alot of luggage to walk with - so take this into consideration. The street is extremely quiet a night - which is a HUGE plus in busy and noisy NYC. The elevator is miniature but very cool - I wanted to spend my time going up and down just for the fun of it. The room I had (private bath) was HUGE - i loved it and it was COMPLETELY QUIET. Never heard anyone in the next rooms -unless they were in the corridors. The staff was pretty nice. The price can't be beaten and the room was actually quite clean - although the look of the room was certainly "used" but who cares? The Bad: There was a problem with my room - and because they were booked, I ended up having to spend two of my 5 nights sleeping in a single room WITHOUT a private bath. I was NOT happy and unfortunately, the front desk staff, while nice, were pretty useless at trying to fix it. It seems only the Manager can make changes of rooms - which he did from the third night onwards and he gave me a great room. Still, I was annoyed at the fact that nobody seemed to be able to "fix" my room problem from the first night and actually give me the room I had booked 3 months before. The TV only has 3 channels - most of which is Law & Order. I like to watch some TV before bed and when I first get up (CNN) and I could not quite believe that i was in NYC and could only have access to 3 channels. In the single room, the TV was miniature and there was no room safe -both problems. Finally, for some weird reason, my message light on my phone kept flashing - despite the fact that I have no messages! Overall, I would definitely go back - but I have never had a trip where so many little things happened to me to annoy.

Reviews.Title: “BEDBUGS!”
Reviews.Author: qualireq
Reviews.Content: I apparently got the lucky room in the hotel as I woke up for several days with bedbug bites! I immediatly alerted the staff who did move me to another room...however, the bugs travel and I continued to receive bites. I ended up checking out of this place and into a much cleaner, better hotel! I was informed that the room I booked is generally booked by "backpackers" who bring the bugs with them...I understand bedbugs happen but this was a poor exscuse, I have stayed in many hostels during my time travelling who have lots of "backpackers" staying there and NO bedbugs! The only positive thing was that the staff was actually able to give me a bit of a refund for the inconvenience but I would advise to stay somewhere else! Don't stay here unless you want to get bitten!

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but rooms are big”
Reviews.Author: speedgraphic
Reviews.Content: FINALLY, a hotel room in NYC that is BIGGER than you expect! "Ziggy" the front desk guy was a bit of a creep as an 80 year old man desperately trying to lay a finger on my bag to justify a tip (which I reluctantly gave even though he carried nothing), but otherwise this hotel is great. It's a bit stuck in the late 80s-early 90s with the old tube TV, but who's going to watch it anyways? The beds were OK and the view from our room was great. The only downside to this hotel is, being in the Murray Hill area, we found ourselves taking crosstown buses/transferring more often than we'd like to reach the tourist attractions, but the area is also lower key and quieter, so that's nice too. They also stored our luggage for a few hours free of charge. Plus, free WiFi!

Reviews.Title: “great value, vintage feel”
Reviews.Author: karena58
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in NYC for a long weekend of sight seeing and theatre-the hotel was very clean, a bit of a 'tower of terror' feel about it (i.e. narrow hallways, old-fashioned elevator), but everyone was very accommodating. The room was small but we were only there to sleep-so not a problem! We felt very safe walking to and from downtown ~20 minute brisk walk from Times square. If you don't mind a bit of a walk and want to save some $ to spend on activities, this is the place for you. There are two cafes at the end of the street where you can grab a good breakfast to start the (long) days :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for nyc. Looking for a Place...”
Reviews.Author: grafzahl
Reviews.Content: Great Value for nyc. Looking for a Place to stay in Manhatten, not too expensive and clean. Go there! Rooms are small and dark but also clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Definetely worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jemimagrace
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Paying $120 a night for a room with a shared bath, I thought the hotel would be gross, dirty and smelly. It did smell faintly of cigarettes, but other than that it was fine. The room had a sink, TV, mirror and hair dryer, which I didn't expect. However the walls are very thin so I could hear people outside moving around & talking, especially as my room was next to the bathroom and stairwell. The free wifi was really good too. If you're on a budget, I reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel086
Reviews.Content: We were there 6 nights and we loved it! Rooms are small but we just sleep there so we didn't care. The location is great and the hotel is very clean and sweet! I'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at little gem, Would go back tomorrow.”
Reviews.Author: djy100
Reviews.Content: This is a real gem in the city, all the staff were really helpful no request was a problem to the guys. The room was impeccably clean, not too small with everything you need. It was quiet which meant a good sleep for the next days sightseeing, but was close to subway, local shops, a great pizza place on the corner and a good diner (Murray Hill Diner) few blocks away. Ive had worse service in 4 star hotels, can't recommend enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Money”
Reviews.Author: drfilomena
Reviews.Content: We certainly got our money's worth. The room, though not big, was certainly not the the smallest we've been in and it was kept impeccably clean. We stayed there for a week and during this entire time, I only ran into the "problem" of both toilets on our floors being occupied. No biggie, solved that one by going one floor down. When it got cold, the friendly staff brought an extra heater and blankets. We didn't stay in the room all that much, too busy spending our money on Broadway shows rather than expensive hotel rooms. Thanks, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of advantages, but...”
Reviews.Author: Varanasie
Reviews.Content: Although Hotel 31 has many advantages (it is clean, rather quiet and very well located) I would not recommend it because of its staff. Since I could not use my first night I had booked through Expedia, due to the terrible weather conditions in February in NY, I did inform the hotel in time. But when I checked in the next day, the manager refused to re-imburse me or even to try to find any sort of agreement. morecover, he sounded rather disrespectful. I will not stay in this hotel again, and will certainly not use Expedia ever again to book any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: emilycatherine
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend alone in New York and Hotel 31 was the perfect place to sleep: quiet, clean, well-kept, with the building and rooms renovated, but with original character intact. Shared bathroom did not feel shared. Perfectly clean and comfortable, and with a sink in my room, I didn't have to venture out late for tooth-brushing and face-washing. Comfy bed. My only complaint is too-high heat in the cold cold winter. I ran the AC to counter this. Loud AC. But I slept like a baby. Will most definitely return to Hotel 31. Where else can you stay central Manhattan for $80/night in a lovely room?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: nellie26
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was brilliant, clean and friendly. Rooms aren't the largest, but you go to NYC to explore, not stay in!! Very close to the number 6 subway at 33rd and Park (takes you up the east side to the Bronx and downtown to Brooklyn Bridge), loads of coffee places and resturants nearby. Pick up the little cards in the lobby as they can give you discounts to places and products. 5-10 minute walk to the Empire State Building, Times Square etc.... Recommend taking the bus tours that go from Times Sq, brilliant way to see places and its a hop on-hop off service. Had a fantastic time, can't wait to go back. ENJOY!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: VampireNanny
Reviews.Content: They are RAMPANT in NY hotels- and apparently this one is no exception! See Nov 2009 pix of "ticks" from another traveller

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room, Great Value, Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: Weash24
Reviews.Content: We had a private room with a double bed and shared bath. This hotel is the coolest mix of hotel/hostel hybrid. I highly recommend staying here. Fantastic location - two blocks from subway, very short subway trip to Grand Central Station. 3 blocks to Starbucks. Our room was on the 7th floor with a great view of Empire State Bldg out our window! We had noisy neighbors, but the hotel took care of it right away. Nice staff. Room was clean & just big enough. Room had a sink & mirror, small desk & small tv. Two small bathrooms on our floor, plenty of hot water for showers (hot water did fluctuate some while showering - eek!). Hotel provided mini soaps & towels too. Hotel 31 is very vintage, cool architecture. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't worry about the shared bathrooms! Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: catcat2181
Reviews.Content: I looked for a hotel in New York for ages that was the right price, location and also that had good reviews. This is the best that I found. I was a bit worried about the shared bathrooms but this turned out to not be an issue at all! We arrived a day late because of a delayed flight. The taxi found the hotel straight away ($45 from JFK). The lift is tiny and the stairs are quite narrow too, but as far as im concerned this didnt matter at all. The room we had was quite small, but was really clean and cosy (it was -7 outside!). The first time i used the shower, my other half went to use it right after me. The time it took me to get out and him to get in there was already a lady in there cleaning it! The only draw backs re the showers: towels are slightly small and once they have cleaned the shower they pull the shower curtain across...this freaked me out everytime i went to the loo coz i had to pull it back and make sure there was no crazy killer in there! (ha ha ha) I would def. use this hotel again. The location was excellent and there is a great sushi place right next door. Staff were incredibly helpful, letting us use their fax machine for free after the airline lost out luggage. They did forget our wakeup call the day we were due to depart tho so I would recommend taking an alarm clock or using your phone. Overall, great place, location, price and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect No Frills hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: KMuz
Reviews.Content: I originally booked this hotel because of the reviews on this website and because it was the cheapest hotel I could find. I was a bit nervous before we got there because you never know with cheap hotels but I had no reason to worry. The hotel is in an excellent location, a 2 minute walk to the subway, 3 mins to the Empire State Building, a nice 10 min walk to Times Square, and there are loads of cafes, delis etc close by, there is an internet cafe 2 blocks away too. The staff were friendly and helpful. BA lost my boyfriend's suitcase and the staff at hotel 31 advised us where the nearest inetrnet cafe and market was so we could sort ourselves out for the next couple of days. Our suitcase was delivered to the hotel without any warning but the staff at hotel 31 took the suitcase and let us know that it had arrived. The room was small, yes, but it wasn't TINY. There was more than enough room for us and our suitcases. We stayed on the 5th floor and we had a view of the empire state building right outside our window! We had the shared bathroom option and the bathrooms were always spotless, I have a suspicion that they have a little bathroom fairy who cleans the bathroom every time someone uses it! I am a very messy person who leaves stuff lying around and I have to say that the cleaners on the 5th floor deserve a raise! Everytime we came back from our journeys around the city our room was spotless and the cleaners had picked up all my crap off the floor and put it on top of my suitcase. The bed was very comfortable and the heater worked very well! A little too well at times but that was easily sorted by opening the window a bit. If you are looking for somewhere cheap that is in an excellent location, this is the place to go! But if you expect the red carpet to be rolled out, room service and a gourmet breakfast every morning, try the Hilton or something.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but still a good choice”
Reviews.Author: bebe12
Reviews.Content: Great location for a good price - subway is only a 3 minute walk away. 10 minute walk to Macy's, a few minutes stroll to Empire State building and many cafes/restaurants/grocers nearby. Breakfast is not served in the hotel but you could grab one at any of the cafes. The hotel is a refurbished old building which makes it very quaint. The lift dates back forever ! One of those ancient tiny ones with a grill door - I personally loved it bt if you are in a hurry and there are people using the lift, choose the staircase instead. We took a double bed room with a private bath and although it was very small, it was clean and adequate. For those who are claustropobic, the room size may be an issue if staying more than a few nights. We had a few large bags which luckily could be placed near the room door ( relatively big corner right at the room entrance ). For those contemplating the shared bathroom, I noticed they were always clean - not sure whether it's because of relatively low occupancy - but there are 2 per floor and they must have been cleaned quite often. Next time round, I would consider the shared bathroom option. The lobby is also tiny with barely any room to stand your bags but then, who spends much time in the lobby anyways. Be careful about using the hotel room phone - very expensive, sometime like USD8+ per minute. Special thanks to Frederick, the frontdesk manager who was very helpful - gave us advice on parking, booked a private airport car to Newark that saved us 20 bucks compared to booking it ourselves. Overall, was happy with my choice and would definitely recommend to friends...

Reviews.Title: “Charged over 108 USD for a phone call!”
Reviews.Author: Ouch22
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately i had a relative pass away and urgently needed to use the phone to call home. I did - there was no information or due warning regarding the potential extortion price of one phone call. One 12 minute call and i could have stayed in a better hotel for night. When i asked to speak to the manager he was no avaliable and would not be avaliable tomorrow either. I walked out upset with yet another crampy hotel service. The way i was spoken to was a joke, i walked out and vowed to write a review to inform everybody else of my wrong doing... i should have brought a phone card, but at a urgent matter arose i thought best to deal with the situation at hand. I would tell this manager, you cant charge this price, without due information avaliable on hand, as was the price listed in all the other US hotels, i stayed in..

Reviews.Title: “Why spend more?”
Reviews.Author: jac152
